================================================================================
                    PrintClientPro - Installation Guide
                          Windows Auto-Start Edition
================================================================================

WHAT YOU HAVE
=============

This folder contains a complete, portable installation of PrintClientPro.
Everything you need is right here - no additional installation required!

FILES IN THIS FOLDER:
---------------------
  [X] PrintClientPro.exe       - Main application
  [X] .env                     - Your configuration file
  [X] SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat      - Setup auto-start (DOUBLE-CLICK THIS)
  [X] REMOVE_AUTOSTART.bat     - Remove auto-start
  [X] START_HERE.bat           - Interactive menu
  [X] wkhtmltopdf.exe          - PDF converter (recommended)
  [X] SumatraPDF.exe           - Alternative PDF tool
  [X] README_AUTOSTART.txt     - Detailed documentation
  [X] printer_settings.json    - Printer configurations
  [X] This file                - Installation guide


================================================================================
                         STEP-BY-STEP SETUP
================================================================================

STEP 1: CONFIGURE AUTO-START (5 seconds)
-----------------------------------------
  1. Double-click: SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat
  2. Wait for setup to complete
  3. Press 'Y' when asked if you want to start now

  DONE! PrintClientPro will now start automatically every time you boot your PC.


STEP 2: VERIFY CONFIGURATION (Optional)
----------------------------------------
  Your current settings are in the .env file:

  Server:   https://socket.pss.al
  NIPT:     PSSTEST
  Username: printer_client

  To change these:
    1. Start PrintClientPro
    2. Click "‚öôÔ∏è Configuration" button
    3. Edit settings
    4. Click "üíæ Save"


STEP 3: TEST (1 minute)
-----------------------
  Option A - Start Manually:
    - Double-click PrintClientPro.exe
    - Check if it connects to the server
    - Try a test print

  Option B - Test Auto-Start:
    - Restart your computer
    - After login, PrintClientPro should start automatically


================================================================================
                              WHAT HAPPENS NOW
================================================================================

AUTOMATIC STARTUP:
  ‚úì Windows creates a shortcut in your Startup folder
  ‚úì Every time you log into Windows, PrintClientPro starts
  ‚úì The application connects to the server automatically
  ‚úì Ready to receive print jobs immediately

CONFIGURATION:
  ‚úì .env file contains all your settings
  ‚úì Can be edited through the GUI or manually
  ‚úì Settings are saved in this folder (portable)

PORTABLE:
  ‚úì You can move this entire folder anywhere
  ‚úì Copy to other computers
  ‚úì No registry entries (except the startup shortcut)
  ‚úì Easy to backup and restore


================================================================================
                           CURRENT CONFIGURATION
================================================================================

Location of this folder:
  C:\Users\user\Desktop\ParidBackend\PrinterClientPro\Windows-Printer-Client\dist

Startup shortcut will be created at:
  %APPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\PrintClientPro.lnk

Configuration file (.env):
  SOCKET_URL = https://socket.pss.al
  NIPT = PSSTEST
  SESSION_ID = printer_client_session_001
  CLIENT_USERNAME = printer_client
  PDF_CONVERTER = wkhtmltopdf


================================================================================
                              COMMON TASKS
================================================================================

TASK: Change server configuration
  1. Double-click PrintClientPro.exe
  2. Click "‚öôÔ∏è Configuration"
  3. Change "Socket Server URL" or other settings
  4. Click "üíæ Save"
  5. Restart the application

TASK: Configure printers
  1. Open PrintClientPro
  2. Click "üñ®Ô∏è Printers" tab
  3. Set printer aliases and descriptions
  4. Click "üíæ Save Settings" for each printer

TASK: View logs
  1. Open PrintClientPro
  2. Check the "üìã Console Log" tab
  3. Or open printer_client_gui.log with Notepad

TASK: Test printing
  1. Open PrintClientPro
  2. Connect to server (green "Connected" status)
  3. Click "üß™ Test Print" button
  4. Check your default printer

TASK: Disable auto-start
  1. Double-click REMOVE_AUTOSTART.bat
  2. Confirm removal
  3. PrintClientPro will no longer start automatically

TASK: Re-enable auto-start
  1. Double-click SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat
  2. Setup runs again
  3. Auto-start is restored


================================================================================
                           TROUBLESHOOTING
================================================================================

PROBLEM: Auto-start doesn't work after reboot
  SOLUTION:
    1. Open Windows Startup folder (Win+R, type: shell:startup)
    2. Check if PrintClientPro.lnk exists
    3. If missing, run SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat again
    4. If exists, right-click ‚Üí Properties ‚Üí check path is correct

PROBLEM: Application starts but doesn't connect
  SOLUTION:
    1. Check .env file - make sure SOCKET_URL is correct
    2. Verify network connection
    3. Check firewall settings
    4. Review logs in printer_client_gui.log

PROBLEM: Prints don't work
  SOLUTION:
    1. Check if printer is online (Windows Settings ‚Üí Printers)
    2. Try test print from Windows
    3. Check PrintClientPro logs
    4. Verify printer name matches

PROBLEM: Want to move this folder to another location
  SOLUTION:
    1. Run REMOVE_AUTOSTART.bat (in current location)
    2. Close PrintClientPro if running
    3. Move entire folder to new location
    4. Run SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat (in new location)

PROBLEM: Setup script fails / Access denied
  SOLUTION:
    1. Right-click SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat
    2. Select "Run as Administrator"
    3. Try again


================================================================================
                          ADVANCED OPTIONS
================================================================================

PORTABLE INSTALLATION ON ANOTHER PC:
  1. Copy this entire folder to USB drive
  2. Transfer to new PC
  3. Run SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat on new PC
  4. Edit .env if server/credentials are different
  5. Done!

RUN WITHOUT AUTO-START:
  - Simply double-click PrintClientPro.exe
  - No setup needed
  - Manual start each time

BACKUP YOUR CONFIGURATION:
  - Copy these files to backup location:
    ‚Ä¢ .env (your settings)
    ‚Ä¢ printer_settings.json (printer configs)
    ‚Ä¢ printer_client_gui.log (if you need logs)

MULTIPLE INSTALLATIONS:
  - You CAN have multiple copies in different folders
  - Each can have different .env configurations
  - But only ONE should have auto-start enabled


================================================================================
                          SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
================================================================================

Operating System:
  ‚úì Windows 7 or later
  ‚úì Windows 10/11 recommended

Permissions:
  ‚úì No administrator rights needed for normal operation
  ‚úì Admin rights may be needed for first-time setup on some systems

Network:
  ‚úì Internet connection to reach socket server
  ‚úì Access to: https://socket.pss.al

Printers:
  ‚úì At least one printer installed in Windows
  ‚úì Printer should be set as online/ready


================================================================================
                          QUICK REFERENCE
================================================================================

Start Application:           Double-click PrintClientPro.exe
Setup Auto-Start:            Double-click SETUP_AUTOSTART.bat
Remove Auto-Start:           Double-click REMOVE_AUTOSTART.bat
Interactive Menu:            Double-click START_HERE.bat
Edit Configuration:          Open .env with Notepad (or use GUI)
View Logs:                   Open printer_client_gui.log
Open Startup Folder:         Win+R ‚Üí type: shell:startup
Check Auto-Start:            Win+R ‚Üí type: shell:startup ‚Üí look for PrintClientPro.lnk


================================================================================
                          SUPPORT & CONTACT
================================================================================

For technical issues:
  1. Check printer_client_gui.log for errors
  2. Verify .env configuration
  3. Test network connectivity
  4. Contact your system administrator

Documentation:
  - README_AUTOSTART.txt (detailed auto-start guide)
  - This file (installation guide)
  - In-app help (coming soon)

                          THANK YOU!
================================================================================

Thank you for using PrintClientPro!

This application is designed to make remote printing simple and automatic.
Once configured, it works silently in the background, ready to print
whenever needed.

If you have any questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate
to contact support.

Happy Printing! üñ®Ô∏è
